meanings.definition: The act of repeating a process or procedure.
meanings.sent1: During each iteration of the experiment, the scientist carefully recorded the results.
meanings.sent2: The software developer tested the code multiple times to ensure each iteration was error-free.
meanings.sent3: The robot's endless iterations of dance moves entertained the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her daily routine felt like an endless iteration of the same tasks.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's patient iteration of the lesson made it easier for the students to understand.

meanings.definition: A single repetition of a process or procedure.
meanings.sent1: After each iteration of the song, the musician made adjustments to improve the performance.
meanings.sent2: The printer produced a perfect iteration of the document on the first try.
meanings.sent3: The chef's perfect iteration of the recipe impressed the restaurant critics.
meanings.sent4: The artist's latest painting was a beautiful iteration of her previous work.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's flawless iteration of the routine earned them a perfect score.
